courses.title: Introduction to Xero
courses.description: The Introduction to Xero course is designed to help participants understand the basics of accounting and bookkeeping using Xero's platform.

content.heading: Introduction to Xero
subtopics: Overview of Xero's interface and features.
Creating and setting up your Xero account.
Navigating the dashboard and menu options.

content.heading: Setting Up Your Organization
subtopics: Adding your company's information and logo.
Configuring your organization's settings.
Setting up financial periods.

content.heading: Chart of Accounts
subtopics: Understanding the chart of accounts and its importance.
Creating and customizing accounts for different types of transactions.
Organizing accounts into categories.

content.heading: Bank Reconciliation
subtopics: Linking your bank accounts and credit cards to Xero.
Reconciling transactions to ensure accurate records.
Handling discrepancies between Xero and your bank statements.

content.heading: Invoicing and Sales
subtopics: Creating and sending invoices to customers.
Managing sales and tracking payments.
Handling GST calculations.

content.heading: Purchases and Expenses
subtopics: Entering bills and expenses into Xero.
Managing vendor payments and tracking outstanding bills.
Managing purchase orders and receipts.

courses.title: Intermediate Xero Course
courses.description: Our Intermediate Xero course builds upon the foundational knowledge gained in the Introductory course. It delves deeper into the functionalities and features of the Xero accounting software.

content.heading: Advanced Transactions
subtopics: Covering more complex transactions like multi-currency transactions, split transactions, and bulk imports.

content.heading: Bank Reconciliation
subtopics: Going beyond the basics to address more intricate scenarios with other account types such as go cardless, Square and eWay.
Reconciling multiple bank accounts, dealing with discrepancies, and handling unreconciled items.

content.heading: Reporting
subtopics: Exploring more reporting options such as customizing financial reports, creating and analysing budget reports, and generating variance analysis reports.

content.heading: Fixed Assets
subtopics: Understanding how to record and manage fixed assets, calculating depreciation, and generating relevant reports.

content.heading: Integrations
subtopics: Exploring integrations with other software and apps that can enhance the functionality of Xero, such as CRM systems, e-commerce platforms, and project management tools.

content.heading: Troubleshooting
subtopics: Developing the skills to diagnose and resolve common issues or discrepancies that might arise while using the software.

content.heading: Experience Gained Through Real-life Scenarios
subtopics: Working through case studies and practical examples that simulate real-world accounting scenarios to reinforce learning.

courses.title: Advanced Xero
courses.description: An advanced Xero course typically builds upon the foundational knowledge gained in basic or introductory Xero courses. Xero is a popular cloud-based accounting software that is used by businesses for various accounting and financial tasks. This advanced course dives deeper into the more complex features and functionalities of the software.

content.heading: Advanced Financial Reporting
subtopics: In this section, you might learn about creating custom financial reports, using the report layouts effectively, and utilizing advanced reporting tools to analyze your business's financial health.

content.heading: Advanced Automation
subtopics: This could include more in-depth training on automating processes like recurring invoicing, bill payments, bank reconciliations, and reminders.

content.heading: Inventory Management
subtopics: If your business deals with inventory, the course might cover how to manage and track inventory within Xero, including handling variations, stock adjustments, and managing inventory valuations.

content.heading: Project Tracking
subtopics: Many businesses use Xero for project-based accounting. The advanced course might teach you how to set up and track projects, allocate costs, and analyze project profitability.

content.heading: Advanced Payroll
subtopics: If you use Xero for payroll processing, the course might cover complex payroll scenarios, benefits administration, superannuation (retirement savings) handling, and compliance with labor laws.

content.heading: Multi-Currency Transactions
subtopics: For businesses dealing with different currencies, the course could provide guidance on handling multi-currency transactions, including exchange rate management and currency gains/losses.

content.heading: Advanced Bank Reconciliation
subtopics: This might cover handling more complex bank reconciliation scenarios, such as dealing with unidentified transactions, handling discrepancies, and managing bank rules.

content.heading: Integration with Third-Party Apps
subtopics: Xero integrates with various third-party apps for different business needs. The course could teach you how to set up and manage these integrations effectively.

content.heading: Customization and Settings
subtopics: Learn about advanced customization options for invoices, quotes, and other documents. Understand how to set up advanced tracking categories and manage user permissions.

content.heading: Tax and Compliance
subtopics: Dive deeper into tax settings, handling GST, and generating advanced tax reports to ensure compliance with local tax regulations.

content.heading: Data Security and User Access
subtopics: Learn about managing user roles, permissions, and security settings to protect sensitive financial data.

content.heading: Troubleshooting and Advanced Tips
subtopics: Gain insights into resolving complex issues, understanding error messages, and implementing best practices for efficient use of the software.

courses.title: Introduction to Computer Use
courses.description: This "Introduction to Computer Use" course covers essential concepts, skills, and tools that are fundamental for effectively using computers in various contexts. The course is designed to provide a solid foundation for individuals who have limited or no prior experience with computers, enabling them to become more comfortable and confident in using these essential tools in various aspects of life, work, and study.

content.heading: Computer Basics
subtopics: Overview of computer hardware components (CPU, memory, storage devices, input/output devices).
Understanding computer software (operating systems, applications).
Differentiating between software and hardware.

content.heading: Operating Systems
subtopics: Introduction to common operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux).
Navigating the user interface and using essential features.
Managing files and folders.

content.heading: Software Applications
subtopics: Introduction to productivity software (word processors, spreadsheets, presentation tools).
Basic tasks like creating, editing, and formatting documents.

content.heading: Internet and Web Browsing
subtopics: Navigating web browsers.
Searching the internet effectively.
Understanding web addresses (URLs).
Basic online safety and privacy.

content.heading: Email Communication
subtopics: Setting up and using email accounts.
Sending, receiving, and managing emails.
Attachments and basic email etiquette.

content.heading: File Management
subtopics: Organizing and managing files and folders.
Basic file operations (copying, moving, deleting).
Introduction to cloud storage.

content.heading: Basic Troubleshooting
subtopics: Identifying common computer issues.
Restarting and shutting down computers.
Dealing with frozen applications.

content.heading: Security and Privacy
subtopics: Basics of online security.
Creating strong passwords.
Recognizing phishing attempts and malware.

content.heading: Digital Citizenship
subtopics: Responsible and ethical use of computers and the internet.
Citing online sources and respecting copyright.

content.heading: Introduction to Computer Hardware
subtopics: Overview of computer components (CPU, RAM, hard drive, etc.).
Basic troubleshooting for hardware issues.

content.heading: Keyboard and Mouse Skills
subtopics: Developing efficient typing and navigation skills.
Keyboard shortcuts for common tasks.

content.heading: Basic Computer Maintenance
subtopics: Keeping the computer clean and organized.
Software updates and maintenance tasks.

content.heading: Hands-on Practice
subtopics: Practical exercises and assignments to apply learned concepts.
Guided tasks to reinforce skills.

courses.title: Introduction to Microsoft Word
courses.description: The introduction to Microsoft Word course aims to familiarize participants with the basic tools, features, and functions of Microsoft Word, enabling them to create, edit, and format documents efficiently.

content.heading: Getting Started with Microsoft Word
subtopics: Introduction to the Microsoft Word interface.
Navigating the ribbon, tabs, and menus.
Creating a new document and opening existing ones.
Saving and managing documents.

content.heading: Text Entry and Editing
subtopics: Typing and formatting text.
Selecting, copying, cutting, and pasting text.
Undo and redo actions.
Using the clipboard effectively.

content.heading: Basic Formatting
subtopics: Font styles, sizes, and colors.
Applying bold, italic, underline, and strikethrough.
Changing text alignment and line spacing.
Using formatting shortcuts.

content.heading: Paragraph Formatting
subtopics: Indenting paragraphs.
Adjusting line spacing and paragraph spacing.
Creating bulleted and numbered lists.
Using tabs and alignment.

content.heading: Page Layout
subtopics: Setting margins.
Adjusting page orientation (portrait vs. landscape).
Adding headers and footers.
Page numbering.

content.heading: Document Elements
subtopics: Inserting and formatting images and shapes.
Adding tables and adjusting table properties.
Including hyperlinks.
Inserting symbols and special characters.

content.heading: Styles and Themes
subtopics: Applying and customizing document styles.
Using themes for consistent design.
Modifying heading styles.

content.heading: Spell Checking and Proofreading
subtopics: Running spell and grammar checks.
Using thesaurus and language options.
Tracking changes and comments.

content.heading: Document Views
subtopics: Switching between different views (Print Layout, Web Layout, Draft).
Zooming in and out for easier editing.

content.heading: Printing and Sharing
subtopics: Previewing and printing documents.
Saving documents in different formats (PDF, Word, etc.).
Sending documents via email or sharing on cloud platforms.

content.heading: Efficiency Tips and Shortcuts
subtopics: Using keyboard shortcuts to speed up tasks.
Customizing the Quick Access Toolbar.
Utilizing AutoCorrect and AutoText.

content.heading: Advanced Topics (Optional)
subtopics: Mail merge for creating personalized documents.
Creating and formatting long documents (such as reports and theses).
Using templates to streamline document creation.

courses.title: Introduction to Microsoft Excel
courses.description: The introduction to Microsoft Excel course covers the fundamental concepts and skills required to effectively use Excel for data management, analysis, and visualization. The course is designed for beginners who may have little to no prior experience with the software. The course includes:

content.heading: Getting Started with Excel
subtopics: Overview of Excel's interface, including the Ribbon, menus, and tools.
Navigating worksheets and workbooks.
Creating and saving new workbooks.

content.heading: Entering and Formatting Data
subtopics: Inputting data into cells.
Basic formatting options for text, numbers, and dates.
Using fonts, colors, and cell borders.

content.heading: Basic Formulas and Functions
subtopics: Introduction to formulas and cell references (e.g., A1, B2).
Using basic mathematical operators (+, -, *, /).
Common functions like SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT, MIN, and MAX.

content.heading: Working with Rows, Columns, and Cells
subtopics: Inserting, deleting, and moving rows and columns.
Merging and splitting cells.
Adjusting column width and row height.

content.heading: Managing Worksheets and Workbooks
subtopics: Adding, renaming, and deleting worksheets.
Linking data between worksheets.
Grouping and ungrouping worksheets.

content.heading: Cell Formatting and Styles
subtopics: Custom number formats.
Applying cell styles and themes.
Using conditional formatting to highlight data.

content.heading: Data Sorting and Filtering
subtopics: Sorting data by one or multiple columns.
Applying filters to display specific data subsets.
Using AutoFilter and advanced filter options.

content.heading: Data Visualization
subtopics: Creating basic charts (bar, column, line, pie).
Formatting and customizing charts.
Adding chart elements like titles and legends.

content.heading: Introduction to Data Analysis
subtopics: Using basic Excel functions for data analysis.
Creating PivotTables for summarizing and analyzing data.
Using PivotCharts for interactive data visualization.

content.heading: Basic Data Validation and Protection
subtopics: Setting up data validation rules.
Protecting cells, worksheets, and workbooks with passwords.

content.heading: Introduction to Macros (Optional)
subtopics: Recording and playing back simple macros.
Basic understanding of automation through macros.

content.heading: Tips for Efficiency
subtopics: Keyboard shortcuts for common tasks.
Time-saving techniques for navigating and working with large datasets.

content.heading: Projects and Practical Exercises
subtopics: Applying the skills learned to real-world scenarios.
Creating a simple budget, expense tracker, or data summary.
